message.content:
We want to find a positive value, so we can subtract the terms in any order: \begin{align*}
2005^{\mathrm{th}}\text{ term} - 2000^{\mathrm{th}}\text{ term} &= (10 + 5d) - (-8 + 0d) \\
&= 18 + 5d
\end{align*}Since we want a positive value, we can set $d = -4,$ and the positive difference is $18+5d = \boxed{2}.$
